title: Dessert Chai
description: Flavours of premium pistachios, sweet and rich saffron and the aroma of cardamom, comes alive in this cuppa.
method: Bring milk to boil. (Tastes best when made only with milk) Steep 1 tsp of Dessert Chai and boil for 2-3 minutes on low flame. Tastes best with sugar.
ingredients: Black Tea (85%), Cardamom (10%), Natural Kesar Pista Flavour

title: Caramel Green chilli
description: This curated tea combines the brisk sweetness of caramel with high notes of chilli, making this the perfect cup of tea for indulgent dessert evenings.
method: Bring a mix of water and milk in the ratio 70:30 to boil Steep 1 tsp of Achari Chai and boil for 2-3 minutes on low flame Tastes best with sugar
ingredients: Black Tea (85%), Green Chilli (10%), Natural Caramel Flavour

title: Saunf Masala Chai
description: Saunf Masala Chai is a blend of everyday Indian kitchen flavours. This full-bodied tea has hints of cardamom, star anise, black pepper, ginger and fennel.
method: Bring a mix of water and milk in the ratio 70:30 to boil. Steep 1 tsp of Saunf Masala Chai and boil for 2-3 minutes on low flame. Tastes best with sugar.
ingredients: Black Tea (61%), Fennel (11%), Black Pepper (7%), Cardamom (7%), Ginger (7%), Star Anise (7%)

title: Cinnamon clove
description: This full-bodied smooth tea with sweet rich cinnamon and an enticing aroma of clove makes this a memorable cup of tea.
method: Bring a mix of water and milk in the ratio 70:30 to boil. Steep 1 tsp of Cinnamon Clove and boil for 2-3 minutes on low flame. Tastes best with sugar.
ingredients: Black Tea (59%), Cinnamon (17%), Black Pepper (12%), Clove (12%)

title: Paan Cardamom
description: An after-meal green tea  that combines beetlenut leaves with  flavours of cardamom, leaving you refreshed.
method: Bring water to boil at 90 ℃. Put 1 and a half tsp of Paan Cardamom in a teapot and pour water. Let it brew for 2-3 minutes.
ingredients: Green Tea (90%), Cardamom (8%), Natural Paan Flavour

title: Spicy Guava
description: This curated tea has flavours of spicy, tangy guava and crushed green chillies, combined with great quality green tea.
method: Bring water to boil at 90 ℃. Put 1 and a half tsp of Spicy Guava in a teapot and pour water. Let it brew for 2-3 minutes. Strain into a cup and enjoy.
ingredients: Green Tea  (87%), Green Chilli (8%), Natural Spicy Guava Flavour

title: Darjeeling Spring Blossom
description: Soothe your mind as you enjoy a hot cup of tea with light, floral and delicate tasting notes.
method: Bring water to boil and turn the flame off Add 1 teaspoon of black tea and brew for 2-3 mins to achieve perfect strength Tastes best without milk and sugar

title: Darjeeling Rare Wonder
description: Darjeeling Rare Wonder Black Tea is delicately hand-rolled and oxidized to bring out the best taste and aroma of prime flush tea leaves.
method: Bring water to boil and turn the flame off Add 1 tsp of black tea and brew for 2-3 minutes to achieve perfect strength. Tastes best without milk and sugar

title: Kolkata Street Chai
description: Our Kolkata Street Chai combines the rich taste of Assam tea leaves, topped up with spices like cardamom, ginger and nutmeg. Sip the warmth in every cup.
method: Bring a mix of water and milk in the ratio 70:30 to boil Steep 1 tsp of Kolkata Street Chai and boil for 2-3 minutes on low flame Tastes best with sugar

title: Cream of Assam
description: Enjoy a hot cup of Cream of Assam Tea, renowned for its aroma and rich malty notes.
method: Bring a mixture of water and milk in the ratio 60:40, to boil Add a teaspoon of the tea and boil for 2-3 mins Tastes best with sugar

title: Assam Orthodox
description: Rich in colour and deeply satisfying, the Assam Orthodox mildly sweet, medium strength black Tea is perfect to consume throughout the day.
method: Bring water to boil and turn the flame off Add 1 tsp of black tea and brew for 2-3 minutes to achieve perfect strength Tastes best without milk and sugar

title: Nilgiri Green Twirl
description: The Nilgiri Green Twirl is a delicate floral tea that will heighten your senses and leave you mesmerized- a tea to savour and cherish.
method: Bring water to pre-boil and turn the flame off Add 1 tsp of green tea and brew for 2-3 minutes to achieve perfect strength Tastes best without milk and sugar

title: Munnar Green With Rose
description: A luxuriant green tea rich in antioxidants, the Munnar  Green Tea leaf and rose petals are both picked from the high slopes, of Munnar, to give you a taste that is subtle with sweet, floral notes.
method: Bring water to pre-boil and turn the flame off Add 1 tsp of green tea and brew for 2-3 minutes to achieve perfect strength Tastes best without milk and sugar
ingredients: Green Tea (98.5%), Rose Oil (0.1%), Rose Petals (1.4%)

title: Masala Chai
description: With Assam Masala Chai , expect,a strong, bold, rich and earthy cup of tea, with aromatic and spicy notes.
method: Bring a mix of water and milk in the ratio 70:30 to boil Steep 1 tsp of Masala Chai and boil for 2-3 minutes on low flame Tastes best with sugar
ingredients: Black Tea (80%), Cardamon (4%), Cinnamon (5%), Ginger (4%), Clove (3%), Black Pepper (4%)

title: Achari Chai
description: The Panch Phoran is a mix of 5 spices, namely fenugreek, kalonji, cumin, black mustard and fennel seeds, inspired by the cuisine of Eastern India.  An unforgettable and unique experience of flavours.
method: Bring a mix of water and milk in the ratio 70:30 to boil Steep 1 tsp of Achari Chai and boil for 2-3 minutes on low flame Tastes best with sugar

title: Munnar Jasmine Green
description: From the pristine hills of Munnar, comes the Jasmine Green. A tea that tastes as divine as it smells- aromatic, elevating and calming.
method: Bring water to pre-boil and turn the flame off Add 1 tsp of green tea and brew for 1-2 minutes to achieve perfect strength Tastes best without milk and sugar

title: Mango Mint
description: Mango, the king of fruits, is known for its sweet taste. Combined with a mellow orthodox tea from Assam and a hint of mint makes for a unique flavour profile that is sweet, light and tingling at the same time.
method: Bring a mix of water and milk in the ratio 80:20 to boil Steep 1 tsp of black tea and boil for 2-3 minutes. Tastes best with sugar To consume it chilled, cool and refrigerate for 3-4 hours
